thread.title: Disneyland Paris charges British visitors 40% more
thread.title_full: Disneyland Paris charges British visitors 40% more

title: Disneyland Paris charges British visitors 40% more
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Disneyland Paris charges British visitors 40% more Britons are paying over the odds for the park Thomas Samson/AFP/Getty Images Andrew Ellson Consumer Affairs Correspondent Published at 12:01AM, July 29 2015 
Disneyland Paris has been charging British holidaymakers up to 40 per cent more than French tourists, according to the European Commission. 
Officials in Brussels have ordered the French authorities to investigate the theme park for overcharging British and German customers. 
The commission said French holidaymakers were being asked to pay only £954 for a premium package that was costing British visitors £1,325. German tourists were being charged even more at £1,734 per customer. About 15 million people visit the theme park every year, making it the 16th most popular tourist destination in the world.
